name: inelegantly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is not attractive, especially because of being awkward in movement or manner: I turned to see her sprawled inelegantly on the floor. He plunged inelegantly into the pool.
in a way that is not skilful or polite in dealing with or expressing something: She quickly and inelegantly changed the subject. There's been some sort of a - to put it inelegantly - massive screw-up. See
inelegant
More examplesFewer examplesThe stool I sat on wobbled and I had to fling out a leg inelegantly to regain my balance. We inelegantly rode our sinking craft in on the surf and dragged it up the beach. She was rather inelegantly known as "the sausage heiress".He managed to let everyone know he was a former champion by inelegantly forcing it into the conversation.
